chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to contact Probation office in Portage, WI by 4pm tomorrow

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Alexander Harper

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech filed the information electronically with the court and has emailed a copy to Atty Zamzow.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

3:13 PM Defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper appeared by video.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Jeffery Alexander Harper.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Zamzow states that the matter is resolved and states agreement.  Atty Juech agrees but states that they need to address the waiver of Prelim.  Defendant agrees.
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea to Count 1. 
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Zamzow waives the PSI request.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments and states that the defendant needs to update his address.  Defendant can't find his address at this time.
Defendant makes a statement.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
AODA and any follow-up treatment
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Update the Clerk of Courts office with address
Cash bond to be applied
Repay Attorney fees
Credit = 2 days (if revoked)

Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm tomorrow 

Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper appeared by video.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Jeffery Alexander Harper. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Court confirms address and phone. Atty Zamzow waives time limits.  Court questions defendant.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits have been waived.  Set for status.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper appeared by phone. 
Defendant has not received the complaint and is being admitted to the hospital tomorrow; requests a reset on the matter until his health is a little better.  Court confirms address.  Atty Juech states that the defendant received the complaint while he was in jail on May 20th.  Defendant states that he may have received it then.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the matter
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper not in court. 
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks the the bond be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. 
Cash bond to be forfieted.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

2:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Alexander Harper appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for Public Defender appointment.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
